trans-unit.source:
Default-Left - Aligns the text to the left
Center - Centers the text
Right - Aligns the text to the right]

Container - The image element inside the section with a specific width. In t3kit it is up to 1400px. Useful to render images not more than 1400px width in big screens for better performance.
Container-fluid - The image element inside the section with a fluid/full-screen width. 100% screen width in any device. Lower performance, but with the ability to design site with a full-screen layout.

If the link title is added at the end of repeated blocks of text, for example “Read more” links at the end of short teasers for blog posts, then you can provide more descriptive link text specifically for screen reader users using Accessible link label.
It will be visually hidden for a normal view.

Body text width relative to the content element.
By default, this is strictly 50% for text and images, but with a smaller image/media, the text will remain 50% until you change it to “auto”
